00029 UINT8 ubColorTables[HVOBJECT_SHADE_TABLES+3][256];

00032 UINT16      ShadeTable[65536];

00035 FLOAT   guiBrightPercent = (FLOAT)1.1;

00037 BOOLEAN ShadesCalculateTables(SGPPaletteEntry *p8BPPPalette)
00038 {
00039 UINT32      uiCount;
00040 
00041             // Green palette
00042             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[0], 0, 255, 0, TRUE);
00043             // Blue palette
00044             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[HVOBJECT_SHADE_TABLES],  0, 0, 255, TRUE);
00045             // Yellow palette
00046             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[HVOBJECT_SHADE_TABLES+1], 255, 255, 0, TRUE);
00047             // Red palette
00048             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[HVOBJECT_SHADE_TABLES+2], 255, 0, 0, TRUE);
00049 
00050             // these are the brightening tables, 115%-150% brighter than original
00051             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[1], 293, 293, 293, FALSE);
00052             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[2], 281, 281, 281, FALSE);
00053             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[3], 268, 268, 268, FALSE);
00054 
00055             // palette 4 is the non-modified palette.
00056             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[4], 255, 255, 255, FALSE);
00057 
00058             // the rest are darkening tables, right down to all-black.
00059             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[5], 195, 195, 195, FALSE);
00060             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[6], 165, 165, 165, FALSE);
00061             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[7], 135, 135, 135, FALSE);
00062             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[8], 105, 105, 105, FALSE);
00063             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[9], 75, 75, 75, FALSE);
00064             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[10], 45, 45, 45, FALSE);
00065             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[11], 36, 36, 36, FALSE);
00066             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[12], 27, 27, 27, FALSE);
00067             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[13], 18, 18, 18, FALSE);
00068             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[14], 9, 9, 9, FALSE);
00069             ShadesCalculatePalette(p8BPPPalette, Shaded8BPPPalettes[15], 0, 0, 0, FALSE);
00070 
00071 
00072       // Remap the shade colors to the original palette
00073       for(uiCount=0; uiCount < (HVOBJECT_SHADE_TABLES+3); uiCount++)
00074       {
00075             FindIndecies(Shaded8BPPPalettes[uiCount], p8BPPPalette, ubColorTables[uiCount]);
00076             ubColorTables[uiCount][0]=0;
00077       }
00078 
00079       return(TRUE);
00080 }
00081 
00082 BOOLEAN ShadesCalculatePalette(SGPPaletteEntry *pSrcPalette, SGPPaletteEntry *pDestPalette, UINT16 usRed, UINT16 usGreen, UINT16 usBlue, BOOLEAN fMono)
00083 {
00084 UINT32 cnt, lumin;
00085 UINT32 rmod, gmod, bmod;
00086 
00087       Assert( pSrcPalette != NULL );
00088       Assert( pDestPalette != NULL );
00089 
00090       for ( cnt = 0; cnt < 256; cnt++ )
00091       {
00092             if(fMono)
00093             {
00094                   lumin=(pSrcPalette[ cnt ].peRed*299/1000)+ (pSrcPalette[ cnt ].peGreen*587/1000)+(pSrcPalette[ cnt ].peBlue*114/1000);
00095                   rmod=usRed*lumin/255;
00096                   gmod=usGreen*lumin/255;
00097                   bmod=usBlue*lumin/255;
00098             }
00099             else
00100             {
00101                   rmod = (usRed*pSrcPalette[ cnt ].peRed/255);
00102                   gmod = (usGreen*pSrcPalette[ cnt ].peGreen/255);
00103                   bmod = (usBlue*pSrcPalette[ cnt ].peBlue/255);
00104             }
00105 
00106             pDestPalette[ cnt ].peRed = (UINT8)__min(rmod, 255);
00107             pDestPalette[ cnt ].peGreen = (UINT8)__min(gmod, 255);
00108             pDestPalette[ cnt ].peBlue = (UINT8)__min(bmod, 255);
00109       }
00110 
00111       return(TRUE);
00112 }

00117 void FindIndecies(SGPPaletteEntry *pSrcPalette, SGPPaletteEntry *pMapPalette, UINT8 *pTable)
00118 {
00119 UINT16 usCurIndex, usCurDelta, usCurCount;
00120 UINT32 *pSavedPtr;
00121 
00122 __asm {
00123 
00124 // Assumes:
00125 //    ESI = Pointer to source palette (shaded values)
00126 //    EDI = Pointer to original palette (palette we'll end up using!)
00127 //    EBX = Pointer to array of indecies
00128 
00129             mov         esi, pSrcPalette
00130             mov         edi, pMapPalette
00131             mov         ebx, pTable
00132 
00133             mov         BYTE PTR [ebx],0                                ; Index 0 is always 0, for trans col
00134             inc         ebx
00135 
00136             add         esi,4                                                                   ; Goto next color entry
00137             add         edi,4
00138             mov         pSavedPtr, edi                                        ; Save pointer to original pal
00139 
00140             mov         usCurCount, 255                                       ; We'll check cols 1-255
00141 
00142 DoNextIndex:
00143 
00144             mov         edi, pSavedPtr                                        ; Restore saved ptr
00145             mov         usCurIndex, 256                                       ; Set found index & delta to some
00146             mov         usCurDelta, 0ffffh                              ; val so we get at least 1 col.
00147 
00148             mov         ecx,255                                                                 ; Check cols 1-255 of orig pal
00149             push  ebx
00150             xor         bx,bx
00151 
00152 NextColor:
00153             xor         ah,ah                       ; Calc delta between shaded color
00154             mov         al,[edi]                                                          ; and a color in the orig palette.
00155             mov         bl,[esi]                                                          ; Formula:
00156             sub         ax,bx                       ;  Delta = abs(red-origred) +
00157             or          ax,ax                                                                   ;          abs(green-origgreen) +
00158             jns         NC1
00159             neg         ax
00160 NC1:mov           dx,ax                       ;          abs(blue-origblue)
00161             xor         ah,ah
00162             mov         al,[edi+1]
00163             mov         bl,[esi+1]
00164             sub         ax,bx
00165             or          ax,ax                                                                   ;          abs(green-origgreen) +
00166             jns         NC2
00167             neg         ax
00168 NC2:add           dx,ax
00169             xor         ah,ah
00170             mov         al,[edi+2]
00171             mov         bl,[esi+2]
00172             sub         ax,bx
00173             or          ax,ax                                                                   ;          abs(green-origgreen) +
00174             jns         NC3
00175             neg         ax
00176 NC3:add           dx,ax
00177 
00178             cmp         dx,usCurDelta                                               ; If delta < old delta
00179             jae         NotThisCol                                                  ;     Save this delta and it's
00180             mov         ax,256                      ; palette index
00181             mov         [usCurDelta],dx
00182             sub   ax,cx
00183             mov         [usCurIndex],ax
00184 NotThisCol:
00185             add         edi,4                                                                   ; Try next color in orginal pal
00186             dec         cx
00187             jnz   NextColor
00188 
00189             pop         ebx
00190             mov         ax,usCurIndex                                               ; By now, usCurIndex holds pal index
00191             mov         [ebx],al                                                          ; of closest color in orig pal
00192             inc         ebx                                                                           ; so save it, then repeat above
00193             add         esi,4                                                                   ; for the other cols in shade pal
00194             dec         usCurCount
00195             jnz         DoNextIndex
00196       }
00197 }
00198 
00199 /**********************************************************************************************
00200  BuildShadeTable
00201 
00202       Builds a 16-bit color shading table. This function should be called only after the current
00203       video adapter's pixel format is known (IE: GetRgbDistribution() has been called, and the
00204       globals for masks and shifts have been initialized by that function), and before any
00205       blitting is done.
00206 
00207       Using the table is a straight lookup. The pixel to be shaded down is used as the index into
00208       the table and the entry at that point will be a pixel that is 25% darker.
00209 
00210 **********************************************************************************************/
00211 void BuildShadeTable(void)
00212 {
00213       UINT16 red, green, blue;
00214       UINT16 index;
00215 
00216       for(red=0; red < 256; red+=4)
00217             for(green=0; green < 256; green+=4)
00218                   for(blue=0; blue < 256; blue+=4)
00219                   {
00220                         index=Get16BPPColor(FROMRGB(red, green, blue));
00221                         ShadeTable[index]=Get16BPPColor(FROMRGB(red*guiShadePercent, green*guiShadePercent, blue*guiShadePercent));
00222                   }
00223 
00224       memset( White16BPPPalette, 65535, sizeof( White16BPPPalette ) );
00225 }
00226 
00227 
00228 /**********************************************************************************************
00229  BuildIntensityTable
00230 
00231       Builds a 16-bit color shading table. This function should be called only after the current
00232       video adapter's pixel format is known (IE: GetRgbDistribution() has been called, and the
00233       globals for masks and shifts have been initialized by that function), and before any
00234       blitting is done.
00235 
00236 
00237 
00238 **********************************************************************************************/
00239 void BuildIntensityTable(void)
00240 {
00241       UINT16 red, green, blue;
00242       UINT16 index;
00243       FLOAT  dShadedPercent = (FLOAT)0.80;
00244 
00245 
00246 #if 0
00247 
00248       UINT32 lumin;
00249       UINT32 rmod, gmod, bmod;
00250 
00251       for(red=0; red < 256; red+=4)
00252             for(green=0; green < 256; green+=4)
00253                   for(blue=0; blue < 256; blue+=4)
00254                   {
00255                         index=Get16BPPColor(FROMRGB(red, green, blue));
00256 
00257                         lumin=( red*299/1000)+ ( green*587/1000 ) + ( blue*114/1000 );
00258 
00259                         //lumin = __min(lumin, 255);
00260                         rmod=(255*lumin)/256;
00261                         gmod=(100*lumin)/256;
00262                         bmod=(100*lumin)/256;
00263 
00264                         //rmod = __m( 255, rmod );
00265 
00266                         IntensityTable[index]=Get16BPPColor( FROMRGB( rmod, gmod , bmod ) );
00267                   }
00268 #endif
00269 
00270 
00271 
00272       for(red=0; red < 256; red+=4)
00273             for(green=0; green < 256; green+=4)
00274                   for(blue=0; blue < 256; blue+=4)
00275                   {
00276                         index=Get16BPPColor(FROMRGB(red, green, blue));
00277                         IntensityTable[index]=Get16BPPColor(FROMRGB(red*dShadedPercent, green*dShadedPercent, blue*dShadedPercent));
00278                   }
00279 
00280 }

00284 void SetShadeTablePercent( FLOAT uiShadePercent )
00285 {
00286       guiShadePercent = uiShadePercent;
00287       BuildShadeTable( );
00288 }

00291 #ifdef JA2  // Jul. 23 '97 - ALEX - because Wizardry isn't using it & no longer has a version of Set8BPPPalette() available
00292 void Init8BitTables(void)
00293 {
00294 SGPPaletteEntry Pal[256];
00295 UINT32 uiCount;
00296 
00297       // calculate a grey-scale table for the default palette
00298       for(uiCount=0; uiCount < 256; uiCount++)
00299       {
00300             Pal[uiCount].peRed=(UINT8)(uiCount%128)+128;
00301             Pal[uiCount].peGreen=(UINT8)(uiCount%128)+128;
00302             Pal[uiCount].peBlue=(UINT8)(uiCount%128)+128;
00303       }
00304 
00305       Pal[0].peRed=0;
00306       Pal[0].peGreen=0;
00307       Pal[0].peBlue=0;
00308 
00309       Set8BPPPalette(Shaded8BPPPalettes[4]);
00310 }
00311 
00312 BOOLEAN Set8BitModePalette(SGPPaletteEntry *pPal)
00313 {
00314       ShadesCalculateTables(pPal);
00315       Set8BPPPalette(pPal);
00316       return(TRUE);
00317 }
00318 #endif
